name: Pick a 'Number' Quiz | Old Testament / Tanakh | 10 Questions

questions.text: On which day of which month did the Lord speak to Moses in Numbers 1:1?
questions.correct: first day of the second month
options: fourth day of the third month
second day of the first month
third day of the fourth month
questions.explanation:
first day of the second month.

	Numbers 1:1 "And the Lord spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tabernacle of the congregation, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt."

questions.text: Complete this verse from Numbers 7:26: "One golden spoon of ten ___________, full of incense."
questions.explanation:
shekels.

	A shekel was a unit of currency and weight for the ancient Hebrews.

Jephunneh.

	Numbers 13:6 "Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh."

questions.text: Fill in the blank from Numbers 14:21 "But as truly as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the ________________ of the Lord."
questions.explanation:
glory.

	I like this verse because it is filled with hope. As long as the Lord lives, the Earth shall be filled with His glory. I believe He has always lived, and always shall live, so therefore, no matter how bad things may seen, there's still hope.

questions.text: How long is a person unclean when he touches a dead body?
questions.explanation:
seven days.

	Numbers 19:11 "He that toucheth the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days."

questions.text: According to Numbers 20:11 where did Moses get water from?
questions.explanation:
rock.

	Numbers 20:11 "And Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice; and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also."

questions.text: In Numbers 21:33, who is the King of Bashan?
questions.explanation:
Og.

	Numbers 21:33 "And they turned and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og the King of Bashan went out against them, he, and all his people, to the battle of Edrei."

Balaam.

	Numbers 22:28 "And the Lord opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee that thou hast smitten me these three time?"

questions.text: How many altars did Balaam tell Balak to build?
questions.explanation:
seven.

	Numbers 23:29 "And Balaam said unto Balak, build me here seven altars and  prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams."

questions.text: How many chapters does the book of Numbers have?
questions.explanation:
36.

	The last verse in Numbers is Numbers 36:13: "These are the commandments and the judgements, which the Lord commanded by the hand of Moses unto the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho."
